title: (x) Blackletters "21st Century Rock'n'Roll" - Kanzlei Bold {Mike F}
content:
Hello,  
This is my first post so I just wanted to say that I really enjoy reading you, interesting topics by passioned people (this is not shoes polish at all).  
I was looking around about blackletters and found this interesting image.  
It looks like Old English or Gothique with some kind of a Fraktur emphasis but I believe it's custom work but not sure, so if you have any ideas, thx

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [blackletter.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20141112181352/http:/typophile.com/files/blackletter.jpg) | 11.88 KB |
author: absynthe

comments.content: Almost for sure custom work, as evidenced by the two different "R" characters for "Rock" and "Roll", respectively.
Yes, I noticed it, but is this just some custom redraw of ligatures and ornements from some blackletter font or a full custom job ?

Most of that, including the first R, matches Kanzlei Bold, stretched vertically a bit. The two digital versions I'm aware of are Dieter Steffmanns [Fette Kanzlei](http://web.archive.org/web/20141112181352/http:/www.moorstation.org/typoasis/designers/steffmann/samples/f/fettekanz.htm) and Paul Lloyd's [Plain Germanica](http://web.archive.org/web/20141112181352/http:/www.moorstation.org/typoasis/designers/lloyd/blackjewels/index.htm) (listed as Germanica).

The top of the k and l, as well as the tail swashes on the C and second R will require custom work.

Thanks a lot Mike, very interesting ressource.  
Amazing work they did on digitalizing those Blackletter fonts (as background work to find some of them I believe), a lot that I never saw anywhere else before.
